page.title: 03WITHYCOMBE FARM,WIVELISCOMBE
page.content: We asked a local farmer's wife about Withycombe Farm, 1km west of Wiveliscombe. On Mrs. Hayes' farm there are 70 cows, 350 ewes, 50 beef cows and 570 lambs. She told us that she doesn't have to do much on the farm, but she does help with calving and lambing. She also told us that it wasn't difficult being a farmer's wife, but she has to be around alot in case there are any accidents or to help in any other way. They have 320 acres, and 50 acres are usually used for corn. There is one field that is very steep and they don't use it that often. They do have farm problems like unsuitable weather, or lambing and calving difficulties. They have two dogs, Jenny and Ted, which are used for herding the stock.
